reviews.text: Stayed at this property for an event in Silver Spring, MD. Location is a little strange - not really sure that it's convenient to anything, but the price was right!
reviews.title: Nicely renovated

reviews.text: Was given a room on the 5th floor (I believe) which I was told was recently renovated. I was pleasantly surprised by the upgraded bathroom fixtures and overall feel of this floor. Very comfortable room.
reviews.title: First Time Guest

reviews.text: Lobby area was unusual for this chain - more like a motel, with a desk and very small seating area at the front. The rest of the public space (where breakfast is served) is down a hallway.
reviews.title: Made Reservation over a month ago

reviews.text: Breakfast was adequate - not as many choices at other Fairfield Inns I've stayed at, but still plenty of offerings.
reviews.title: Awesome General Manager!

reviews.text: Had to make an emergency trip to Maryland and it was not under the best of circumstances - my grandmother was critically ill with no chance of recovery! My mother advised me to come ASAP b/c the doctors d/n know if she'd make it through the night. She made me reservations at Fairfield Inn in Laurel told me all I needed to do is say I was her daughter and to pick up my keys. Unfortunately I d/n make it to the hospital in time and she died before I got there :( The only thing now I could do was assist my mother w/funeral arrangements and the writing of the obituary. This was a very sad time but at least I didn't have to worry about accommodations which was one less thing off my mind. Traveling with your spouse and 4 children can be very trying at times, but like I said, at least everything was taken care of as far as my accommodations. When I got to the hotel, everything was ready! One thing I enjoyed most was the complimentary breakfast and the laundry. Unfortunately, to take advantage of the breakfast you would have to be up bright and early;first come, first serve and the best items went fast - donuts, muffins, fruits, bagels. Now they did provide things like yogurt, hard boiled eggs, hot water to make coffee, hot chocolate, tea, or even oatmeal. My visit was short, not sweet, but at least I was there to provide support for my mother at her time of need and was able to say my final goodbye to my grandmother at her funeral. Nice place to stay!
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and the price was reasonable with a great staff and a good location for the Laurel Regional Hospital. The breakfast has an excellent selection and the coffee is one of the best cups I have had at a hotel. The area is multipurpose so I would never suggest it for anything other than a business stay and I would never consider being out after dark. The down side is if you want to use the pool on a weekday you cannot use it until 3pm.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: The location didn't seem very good but it was the only thing available. As with other Fairfield Inns the rooms were clean and beds are comfortable.
reviews.title: Stopped here for the night

reviews.text: Breakfast is good however get there early as they tend to run out of certain items (I was there on Sunday morn).
reviews.title: Clean, good value

reviews.text: Overall good hotel, good value
reviews.title: Good quality stay

reviews.text: I stayed here with an Explorer Post group on a recent trip to Washington DC, Baltimore and Annapolis. The location was central and the price was reasonable. There were several nearby chain restaurants/.
reviews.title: Group booking worked out well

reviews.text: Stayed for one night for business. The room was clean but I can't believe Marriott has not made any updates to this hotel. Even the lobby was old, the rooms were clean but the stains on the carpet in the halls and lobby are a little disheartening.
reviews.title: Desperate Need for a Remodel

reviews.text: There is a reason why this hotel has rooms for such a cheap price, there's no way they could ask for more for such an outdated hotel. If the hotel ever gets its much needed remodel I would stay again but not a minute before.
reviews.title: Cnvenient location, typical Fairfield Inn

reviews.text: This Fairfield Inn was convenient to a family gathering and we had points for a free night so we stayed here just one night....There was a soccer tournament nearby and so the hotel was filled with various girls of all ages. My sister and mother stayed on the first floor and said the noise from the kids in the hall kept them awake well into the a.m. hours. We were on an upper floor so were not bothered with the noise.
reviews.title: Average

reviews.text: The main problem was with breakfast.. It was crowded and they ran out of some of the food choices... The 2 women worked diligently to keep up with replacing what they could but there were no more egg and sausage sandwiches when we got there as well as no fresh fruit such as bananas. The oatmeal was replentished but we had already eaten by then.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.text: The room was very comfortable but they only provided 2 bath towels and 2 washcloths which were of a very cheap quality. The pillows on the other hand were quite fluffy and plump.. There is no mini fridge in the room. The elevator is noisy and old...We often stay at Hampton Inns and I would say that the Hampton Inns are a few notches above the Fairfields...
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for my boyfriend's graduation from Capitol College. He had to be at the school at 8am so this was in a known part of Laurel. The location is great though hard to get out of during rush hour with the traffic off Route 1. There is a wonderful shopping center nearby with all the basics you could need. This part of Laurel is also being re-done so it was nice, clean, not smokey, and the cliente were fine. I was extremely leary of booking a room in Laurel with security issues. The rooms were clean, breakfast was good (make your own waffles) and staff was friendly.
reviews.title: One Night Stay - May 11, 2012

reviews.text: We just spent 3 lovely nights at the Fairfield Inn, Laurel MD. The hotel is like any other Fairfield Inn. The rooms are nice, clean and spacious- not luxury, but pleasant. The difference is the customer service. Betty at the front desk is the BEST! So is Jamar! Both were so accommodating and friendly- asking how our day was when we came in at night. Betty talked to us about the area and was interested in my daughter's swim meet results. Just really above and beyond what you normally get from a front desk clerk. Great customer service. Also, while the breakfast was pretty basic--- continental w/ waffles- the customer service was again exceptional. Breakfast was to open after the swimmers staying at the hotel had to be at the pool, so the set up crew had everything ready early each morning to accommodate. That was really great and definitely appreciated by the hungry teenagers! My compliments to a great team at the Fairfield Inn, Laurel. Thank you!
reviews.title: Wonderful Customer Service!

reviews.text: Was in the area on business with an associate. Where most other hotels in the area (around $100) offered only 2 double beds, Fairfield Inn offered 2 Queens so I booked here.
reviews.title: Ample, Ample

reviews.text: The inside of the rooms, hallways, doors etc. are a bit dated however, decent beds, cozy pillows and a clean room.Overall it was ok.
reviews.title: Not great, but getting better

reviews.text: My colleagues and I choose this hotel because of its proximity to the local medical center. Definitely a case of convenience over quality. That said, they seem to be doing a better job lately, specifically as it relates to the fitness center. They've gone from one broken treadmill to two modern pieces of cardio equipment (the elliptical and treadmill have attached TVs!). They've also added a nice set of free weights and bench.
reviews.title: Good Quick Stay Hotel
